translated: “The peacock, with his long eyes on his tail-feathers,
Standing on one leg, drinking water, featherless,
By him I am overcome, I weep piteously,

analyzed: mā ha iva mama pāṇa samam jaheyya
translated: Lest he should abandon me as if I were a living being.”
“Noble sir, I will not abandon you,
For the four continents and the earth,
“You are the best of the water-lizards
In the ocean, the Ganges, and the Yamunā;
You are the best of the water-lizards,
Release me, I weep for my mother.”
The Kakkaṭa Jātaka is the seventh.
